algorithm_technique: two pointers and sliding window to find maximum free time by adjusting meetings
problem_summary_simple: Maximize free time by rescheduling up to k meetings while keeping their relative order.
problem_summary_technical: Calculates differences between end and start times, then uses a sliding window of size k to find the maximum cumulative free time.
key_insights: The problem can be reframed as finding the maximum gap between meetings after rescheduling.
Adding eventTime to startTime and 0 to endTime simplifies boundary calculations.
A sliding window of size k allows efficient calculation of free time after rescheduling k meetings.
